The four abodes of bodhisattvas, the old say:

Among the four and three, only the difficulty of non-arising arising, etc. is raised. Among the four statements of non-arising arising, etc., only the arising of arising is raised. The desire to arise from arising extensively explains the various statements.

All difficulties arise from arising, for the sake of permanence, therefore arising? For the sake of impermanence, therefore arising?
For self-arising, or for other-arising?
For original existence, therefore arising? For original non-existence, therefore arising?

If arising is impermanent, then contamination is permanent. Arising itself is impermanent. If impermanent, then it ceases, unable to maintain itself. How can it give rise to contamination?

Next, below World-Honored One, if birth produces itself, is the second conclusion of the difficulty of self-production producing others.

If it has no self-nature, how can it produce others?
That which can produce others is equally producing others, why can it only produce the contaminated other and not produce the uncontaminated other?
The contaminated and uncontaminated are both others in relation to themselves.
World-Honored One, if it has not yet arisen, is the third difficulty.

Now it is the time when conditions come together.

The Buddha said - the second explanation has three parts:

The last one concludes that with causes and conditions, it can also be spoken of, which is to say that with the four siddhÄntas as causes and conditions, it can be spoken of.
